title: Rihanna still faces battles due to race: 'I want to prove people wrong' - Showbiz
text: Rihanna has said that she still faces a constant battle to overcome attitudes about race in her career.Speaking with The New York Times, the Bajan singer revealed the difference in people's perceptions of her after moving from the Caribbean to New York. © Broadimage/REX Shutterstock ''You know, when I started to experience the difference - or even have my race be highlighted - it was mostly when I would do business deals," she explained."That never ends, by the way. It's still a thing. And it's the thing that makes me want to prove people wrong. It almost excites me; I know what they're expecting and I can't wait to show them that I'm here to exceed those expectations."Elsewhere, the singer spoke about learning of sex for the first time, and how she believes people are born with an innate sexuality."Well, there's always this human instinct about that, even from a very, very young age," she added. © Getty Images / Christopher Polk/NBC Rihanna's new album Anti: Everything you need to know, from release date to collaborations''But by like age 11, girls were talking about what they had and hadn't done. I hadn't even kissed a boy yet, so it always made me feel insecure, like I was never gonna be good or ready or know what to do - I didn't even have boobs.''Meanwhile, Rihanna recently revealed the artwork for her eighth album Anti.However, the popstar said that the LP is not yet finished, and that she wants to return to the studio with Kanye West.Watch the video for Rihanna's 'Bitch Better Have My Money' below:
